content: "http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/Health/story?id=7555066&page=1" As part of cost savings, primary care physicians would get most of the control over a patient's health care, and there would be better coordination between patients and their primary care doctors, who would serve as a "coach" and keep track of their patients' health. Potentially cost-cutting measures would reward "physicians for working together to keep people healthy and to bring them back to health as quickly and inexpensively as possible," Fisher said. A plan would also eliminate unnecessary tests and hospital stays, and provide financial incentives to medical providers so they are encouraged to cut costs by avoiding unnecessary services. The administration also wants to streamline the medical process by having one bill for all the tests rather than separate checks for each medical exam and procedure.

content: "http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/Health/story?id=7555066&page=1" As part of cost savings, primary care physicians would get most of the control over a patient's health care, and there would be better coordination between patients and their primary care doctors, who would serve as a "coach" and keep track of their patients' health. Potentially cost-cutting measures would reward "physicians for working together to keep people healthy and to bring them back to health as quickly and inexpensively as possible," Fisher said. A plan would also eliminate unnecessary tests and hospital stays, and provide financial incentives to medical providers so they are encouraged to cut costs by avoiding unnecessary services. The administration also wants to streamline the medical process by having one bill for all the tests rather than separate checks for each medical exam and procedure.

I'm not sure what their complaints are but I'm sure EAG154 will be happy to explain them for us. In countries with privatized health care , you can find doctors, hospitals and patients that don't like it. Some common complaints: Doctors- "I spend too much time filling out forms for the insurance companies, not enough time with my patients." Hospitals- "We can't make a buck because our patients don't pay their medical bills ." (Fun Fact: medical bills are the leading cause of bankruptcy nationwide) Patients- "I can't afford a doctor's visit so I'll just wait until I'm at death's door then go to the emergency room." content: "http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/Health/story?id=7555066&page=1" As part of cost savings, primary care physicians would get most of the control over a patient's health care, and there would be better coordination between patients and their primary care doctors, who would serve as a "coach" and keep track of their patients' health. Potentially cost-cutting measures would reward "physicians for working together to keep people healthy and to bring them back to health as quickly and inexpensively as possible," Fisher said. A plan would also eliminate unnecessary tests and hospital stays, and provide financial incentives to medical providers so they are encouraged to cut costs by avoiding unnecessary services. The administration also wants to streamline the medical process by having one bill for all the tests rather than separate checks for each medical exam and procedure.
